feels.name: Anxiety
feels.quote: The ghosts were returning; they filled Italy, they were even usurping the places she had known as a child. The Sacred Lake would never be the same again, and, on Sunday week, something would even happen to Windy Corner. How would she fight against ghosts? For a moment the visible world faded away, and memories and emotions alone seemed real.

feels.name: Resentment
feels.quote: It was more than her nerves could stand. And she could not protest violently after her mother’s goodness to her upstairs.

feels.name: Dread
feels.quote: How dreadful if she really wished to remain near him! Of course, the wish was due to nerves, which love to play such perverse tricks upon us.

feels.name: Relief
feels.quote: Lucy faced the situation bravely, though, like most of us, she only faced the situation that encompassed her.

feels.name: Irritation
feels.quote: Cecil frowned again. Oh, these Honeychurches! Eggs, boilers, hydrangeas, maids—of such were their lives compact.

feels.name: Displeasure
feels.quote: “May me and Lucy get down from our chairs?” he asked, with scarcely veiled insolence. “We don’t want no dessert.”
